explanation: To determine whether OS_BSP_ConsoleSetMode_Impl violates the MISRA rule against direct or indirect self-calls you must inspect all functions reachable from it and any functions that could lead back to it. 1) OS_BSP_ExecTput — this is the direct callee of OS_BSP_ConsoleSetMode_Impl; you must examine its implementation to confirm it does not call OS_BSP_ConsoleSetMode_Impl or any other function that eventually calls OS_BSP_ConsoleSetMode_Impl (i.e., to detect an indirect cycle). 2) UT_BSP_DoText — according to the static call graph this function calls OS_BSP_ConsoleSetMode_Impl; if OS_BSP_ExecTput (or any function it calls) calls UT_BSP_DoText, that would create an indirect recursion. Include UT_BSP_DoText so the analysis can detect that potential back-edge. (If OS_BSP_ExecTput has additional callees, those transitive callees should also be inspected similarly.)
